intro: Filipendula camtschatica f. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy meadow sweet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges and a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
